question: Do you (they) have any of these life-threatening symptoms?
adult: Severe and constant pain or pressure in the chest
Extreme difficulty breathing (such as gasping for air, being unable to talk without catchingyour (their) breath, severe wheezing, nostrils flaring)
Unconscious or very difficult to wake up
Slurred speech or difficulty speaking (new or worsening)
Signs of low blood pressure (too weak to stand, dizziness, lightheaded, feeling cold, pale,clammy skin)
Dehydration (dry lips and mouth, not urinating much, sunken eyes)
child: Severe and constant pain or pressure in the chest

Extreme difficulty breathing (such as gasping for air, being unable to walk or talk without catching your (their) breath, severe wheezing, nostrils flaring, grunting, or using extra muscles around the chest to help breathe)
Unconscious or very difficult to wake up
Signs of low blood pressure (too weak to stand, dizziness, lightheaded, feeling cold, pale, clammy skin)
Dehydration (dry lips and mouth, not urinating much, sunken eyes)

question: Are you (they) feeling sick?
In the two weeks before you (they) felt sick, have you (they) been in close contact with someone who has COVID-19? —excluding people who have had COVID-19 within the past 3 months.
subheading: You (they) have been in close contact if you (they) have
subQuestion: been within 6 feet of someone who has COVID-19 for a combined total of 15 minutes or more over a 24-hour period or
provided care at home to someone who is sick with COVID-19 or
had direct physical contact (hugged or kissed) with someone who has COVID-19 or
shared eating or drinking utensils with someone who has COVID-19 or
been sneezed on or coughed on by someone who has COVID-19

question: In the last 10 days, have you (they) tested positive for coronavirus?
Do you (they) have any of the following? (check any)
adult: Fever or feeling feverish (such as chills, sweating)
New loss of taste or smell
child: Fever or feeling feverish (such as chills, sweating)
Mild or moderate difficulty breathing (breathing slightly faster than normal, using extra muscles around the chest to help breathe)
Stomach ache or pain in abdomen
New loss of taste or smell

question: Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility, nursing home, or homeless shelter?/Do you (they) live in a group home or other setting with others (pediatric skilled nursing facility,behavioral health center, juvenile detention center, or homeless shelter)?

In the last two weeks, have you (they) worked or volunteered in a healthcare facility or as a first responder? Healthcare facilities include a hospital, medical or dental clinic, long-term care facility, or nursing home./In the last two weeks, have you (they) attended or spent time in a group setting (for example school,dormitory, child care, sporting event)?
Do any of these apply to you (them)? (check any)
adult: Chronic lung disease, such as moderate to severe asthma, COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease), cystic fibrosis, or pulmonary fibrosis
Serious heart condition, such as heart failure cardiomyopathy, heart attack, or blocked arteries to the heart
Weakened immune system or taking medications that may cause immune suppression
Diabetes, chronic kidney disease, or liver disease
Blood disorder, such as sickle cell disease or thalassemia
Cerebrovascular disease or neurologic condition, such as stroke or dementia
child: Lung disease, such as moderate to severe asthma or cystic fibrosis
Serious heart condition, such as congenital heart defect
Weakened immune system or taking medications that may cause immune suppression
Diabetes, kidney disease, or liver disease
Blood disorder, such as sickle cell disease or thalassemia
Neurologic condition, such as cerebral palsy

question: ADULT (Age 18 and Up) Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility, nursing home, or homeless shelter?/Do you (they) live in a group home or other setting with others (pediatric skilled nursing facility, behavioral health center, juvenile detention center, or homeless shelter)?

In the last two weeks, have you (they) worked or volunteered in any healthcare facility or as a first responder?
